title: Mežmuiža Manor
text:
Mežmuiža Manor, also called Augstkalne Manor, is a <a href="Gothic%20Revival%20architecture">Neo-Gothic style</a> manor house in <a href="Augstkalne%20Parish">Augstkalne Parish</a>, <a href="Dobele%20Municipality">Dobele Municipality</a> in the <a href="Semigallia">Semigallia</a> region of <a href="Latvia">Latvia</a>.
History.
Restored between 1992 and 1994, Mežmuiža Manor dates back to the mid seventies of the 19th century. The first owners were the <a href="Lieven">Lieven</a>s.
The main building is located a midst the mills, the gardeners, the maids, and the administrative building, situated a little away from the barns. The manor complex also includes a 12-hectare park with pillars where exotic species are grown, such as <a href="Melissa%20%28plant%29">balm</a>, the <a href="European%20silver%20fir">European silver fir</a>, <a href="red%20oak">red oak</a>, <a href="Pinus%20nigra">black</a> and <a href="mountain%20pine">mountain pine</a>. Since 1954, it has housed the Augstkalne secondary school.
